description.narrative: The Project Development Objectives are to: (i) reduce travel time on selected parts of the classified road network in Northern Ghana, (ii) promote road safety, and (iii) strengthen the institutional management of the transport sector.

condition.narrative: Ensure that not later than six (6) months from the Effective Date, MoT and MRH jointly select a Project Coordinator to carry outthe coordination and implementation of the Project and a Social Development Specialist to carry out the coordination andsupervision of the gender and social aspects of the Project; and
Ensure that said RAP or any of its provisions are not amended, suspended or abrogated as the case may be, without the prioragreement of the Association.

Finance Agreement :Project Coordinator and Social Dev Spec, Schedule 2, Sec I, A, 1(b) of the FA. | Description :The Recipientshall ensure that not later than six (6) months from the Effective Date that the MRH and MoT jointly select a Project Coordinatorto carry out the coordination and implementation of the project and that the GHA appoint a Social Development Specialist to carryout the coordination and supervision of the gender and social aspects of the project. | Due Date :07-January-2019

Prepare prior to the commencement of any works under the Project, a site-specific Environmental and Social Impact Assessment(“ESIA”) and Environmental and Social Management Plan (“ESMP”), satisfactory to the Association, in accordance with theEnvironmental and Social Assessment (“ESA”);

Prior to the commencement of any works under the Project where a Resettlement Action Plan (“RAP”) is required in accordance withthe Resettlement Policy Framework (“RPF”): (i) prepare and carry out consultations on said RAP;(ii) disclose and implement it ina manner satisfactory to the Association; and (iii) provide full compensation as required under the RAP to any persons entitledto said compensation pursuant to the RAP.

The Recipient shall not later than 9 months from the Effectiveness Date, deposit in the said Escrow Account an additional amountnot to exceed three hundred thousand United States Dollars ($300,000) for the purposes of financing the costs in connection withthe implementation of the RAP.
